Breeding adult.description: Royal Terns are slightly smaller with a smaller, more orange bill than Caspian Terns. They have less black on the underside of the primary feathers than Caspian Terns.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Nonbreeding Royal Terns have extensive white on the crown, whereas Caspian Terns are mostly dark on the top of the head with a small area of streaks or white on the forehead. Royal Terns have this white head pattern for most of the year.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Royal Terns have a yellowish bill and extensive white on the crown, whereas young Caspian Terns have reddish bills and all or mostly dark crowns.

Breeding adult.description: Elegant Terns are smaller and slimmer than the bulky-bodied Caspian Tern. Elegant's bill is long, slender, and slightly curved, unlike Caspian's very heavy, bright-red bills.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Elegant Terns are smaller and slimmer than Caspian Terns. The Elegant's long, slender bill is orange rather than red. In nonbreeding plumage Elegant has a white forehead.

Breeding adult.description: Forster's Terns are smaller than Caspian Terns, with a much more slender bill, narrower wings, and a deeply forked tail.
Common Terns are smaller than Caspian Terns, with a much more slender bill, narrower wings, and a deeply forked tail.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Sandwich Terns are smaller than Caspian Terns, with a less bulky body, narrower wings, and a more slender, black bill with yellow tip.
